javadoc.text: * The Poisson distribution is a discrete probability distribution that expresses * the probability of a given number of events occurring in a fixed interval of * time and/or space if these events occur with a known average rate and * independently of the time since the last event. * (The Poisson distribution can also be used for the number of events in other * specified intervals such as distance, area or volume.) * Distribution of number of points in random point process under certain simple * assumptions. Approximation to the binomial distribution when aCount is * large and aProbability is small. aLambda = aCount * aProbability.
javadoc.author: apete
